attributes.action: ensure that the Procurator Fiscal dismisses the action taken against Mr Mancini by Ayrshire Police for blowing his nose at the wheel of his vehicle.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
A businessman has been fined £60 and had his driving licence endorsed for blowing his nose while stuck in a traffic jam.

Michael Mancini, a furniture restorer from Prestwick, Ayrshire, was given the fixed penalty and docked three penalty points after leaning over and pulling out a paper handkerchief to wipe his nose. Mancini said that his van was in neutral with its handbrake on when he was signalled into a parking bay by an approaching policeman Stuart Gray.

This pathetic and pointless prosecution of a law abiding citizen should be dropped as it will;
a) bring the Scottish legal system into disreptute
b) further erode any respect the public has for the Police and the legal system
c) be a waste of public money

For all these reasons and for common sense and fair play, this ridiculous action should be dropped.

rejection.details: This is a devolved matter and should be directed to the Scottish Executive.
reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
